intro: Pelea hosakae, commonly known as the Hosaka's pelea, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
